header.headertext: REVISED MARSHALLED LIST OF AMENDMENTS TO BE MOVED IN GRAND COMMITTEE
The amendments have been marshalled in accordance with the Instruction of 4th June 2013, as follows—

Clause 1 Schedule 1 Clause 2 Schedule 2 Clauses 3 to 7 Schedule 3 Clauses 8 and 9 Schedule 4 Clauses 10 to 17 Schedule 5 Clause 18 Schedule 6 Clauses 19 to 23 Schedule 7 Clauses 24 to 28 Schedule 8 Clauses 29 to 32 Schedule 9 Clause 33 Schedule 10 Clauses 34 and 35 Schedule 11 Clauses 36 to 42 Schedule 12 Clauses 43 and 44 Schedule 13 Clauses 45 to 47
[Amendments marked * are new or have been altered]

text.quote: 1: Clause 1, page 2, line 2, at end insert—

“(6) Before this section is commenced, the Secretary of State shall, by regulations, put into effect arrangements which will enable capacity for a national procurement of external audit to be available if required.”
000: Clause 1, lord Christopher gives notice of his intention to oppose the Question that Clause 1 stand part of the Bill.
2: Schedule 1, page 32, line 14, at end insert—
“(2A) A scheme must include arrangements for the effective future management of the pension scheme, taking account of the Crown guarantee for pension liabilities.”
3: Schedule 1, page 32, line 14, at end insert—

“(2A) The schemes should have the effect of ensuring that the benefit of any local government retained earnings existing immediately prior to the abolition date accrue to the local government sector.”
4: Schedule 1, page 32, line 14, at end insert—
“(2B) The schemes should have the effect of ensuring that the benefit of any health retained earnings existing immediately prior to the abolition date accrue to the health sector.”
5: Schedule 1, page 32, line 14, at end insert—
“(2C) A transfer scheme must make effective arrangements for the management of existing audit contracts entered into with the Audit Commission including regular reporting thereon to Parliament.”
6: Schedule 1, page 32, line 14, at end insert—
“( ) The scheme shall incorporate arrangements to ensure that the value for money profiles are retained, together with the skills to ensure continuity and updating.”
7: Clause 2, page 2, line 9, after “regulations” insert “, but only after consultation with such persons as may be affected by any changes,”
8: Clause 2, page 2, line 16, after “order” insert “, but only after consultation with such persons as are affected by such provisions,”
9: Clause 2, page 2, line 24, at end insert—

“( ) Before promulgating a statutory instrument containing regulations or an order which would fall within section 40(7), the Secretary of State shall publish and consult with relevant persons on a draft thereof.”
10: Schedule 2, page 38, line 7, leave out “5” and insert “7”
11: Clause 3, page 2, line 34, at end insert “and show a true and fair view”
12: Clause 3, page 3, line 1, leave out paragraph (b)
12A*: Clause 3, page 3, line 5, after “application” insert “(including exemption)”
13: Clause 4, page 3, line 23, leave out “by that authority”
13A*: Clause 5, page 4, line 46, at end insert—

“( ) The specified circumstances relating to the accounts of a smaller authority may have regard to the size of electorate, annual income and whether in any given circumstances the application of this Act would be onerous or disproportionate in effect.”

13B*: Clause 6, page 5, line 13, leave out from “income” to the end of line 14 and insert “and its gross annual expenditure taken as an average over three years ending with the last complete accounting year does not exceed £6.5 million.”
14: Clause 6, page 5, line 14, at end insert—
“(2A) The Secretary of State shall issue guidance to determine the definition of gross income and gross expenditure.”
14A*: Clause 9, page 7, line 7, at beginning insert “Save as provided hereunder,”
14B*: Clause 9, page 7, line 8, at end insert—
“( ) The Secretary of State may make regulations exempting or partially exempting a smaller authority from the need to have an audit panel.”
14C*: Clause 12, page 9, line 2, after “group” insert “or an authority exempted under regulations made by the Secretary of State”
15: Schedule 5, page 49, leave out lines 15 and 16
16: Clause 19, page 13, line 6, after “accounts” insert “present a true and fair view and”
17: After Clause 22, insert the following new Clause—
“Auditors right to documents and information of private contractors
(1) A local auditor has a right of access at all reasonable times to audit documents from private companies that the local authority have contracted services to during the last financial year.
(2) A local auditor must publish any audit documents, obtained under subsection (1), as part of a local audit publication.”
18: Schedule 9, page 72, line 9, after “force” insert “on or”
18A*: After Clause 35, insert the following new Clause—
“Public authorities
“( ) The Freedom of Information Act 2000 is amended as follows—
( ) After paragraph 1A of Schedule 1, insert—
“(1B) A local auditor of a local authority.””
19: Schedule 11, page 78, line 22, after “force” insert “on or”
